page.title: 18IRON ACTON FOLK CLUB
page.content: I arrived at 8.15p.m.,and the music was about to start.The folk-club is held each Friday in the back room of the Lamb Inn,and costs Â£1.00 for the evening's entertainment.For the first hour,the compere called various people up to perform.There were so many that there was only time for one item each. Some sang unaccompanied songs; some sang and played guitar;there was a banjo player too.The music included traditional English ballads,American blues,and modern songs in the folk idiom.The performers ranged in age from 7(Fliss,the landlord's daughter) to about 55.The compere then announced the guest for the evening.He sang mainly comic songs,with amusing banter between songs.There was an interval, when people replenished their glasses at the bar,and the pattern was the same in the second half.
